result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew M Spenner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 20 days.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew M Spenner

records.addlTxt: Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on September 16, 2022.
9:30 AM Case not called on the record, parties signed stipulation and order.
Letter from Atty. Amanda Nimmer advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

01:52 PM Defendant Andrew M Spenner in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
